member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.gloInstallerCommandParameters._IsSDKExists
member.summary: This inner class maintains the key names for the parameter values that may be passed on the command line.

member.name: M:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.gloInstallerCommandParameters.InitializeContextParameters(System.Configuration.Install.InstallContext,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: This constructor is invoked by Install class methods that have an Install Context built from parameters specified in the command line. Rollback, Install, Commit, and intermediate methods like OnAfterInstall will all be able to use this constructor.
member.param: The install context containing the command line parameters to set the strong types variables to.

member.name: M:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.gloInstallerCommandParameters.FinalizeContextParameters(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: This constructor is used by the Install class methods that don't have an Install Context built from the command line. This method is primarily used by the Uninstall method.
member.param: An IDictionary object that contains the parameters that were saved from a prior installation.

member.name: M:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.gloInstallerCommandParameters.RemoveContextParameters(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: This constructor is used by the Install class methods that don't have an Install Context built from the command line. This method is primarily used by the Uninstall method.
member.param: An IDictionary object that contains the parameters that were saved from a prior installation.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.ImpersonateUser.LogonTypes.LOGON32_LOGON_INTERACTIVE
member.summary: This logon type is intended for users who will be interactively using the computer, such as a user being logged on by a terminal server, remote shell, or similar process. This logon type has the additional expense of caching logon information for disconnected operations; therefore, it is inappropriate for some client/server applications, such as a mail server.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.ImpersonateUser.LogonTypes.LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK
member.summary: This logon type is intended for high performance servers to authenticate plaintext passwords. The LogonUser function does not cache credentials for this logon type.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.ImpersonateUser.LogonTypes.LOGON32_LOGON_BATCH
member.summary: This logon type is intended for batch servers, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention. This type is also for higher performance servers that process many plaintext authentication attempts at a time, such as mail or Web servers. The LogonUser function does not cache credentials for this logon type.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.ImpersonateUser.LogonTypes.LOGON32_LOGON_SERVICE
member.summary: Indicates a service-type logon. The account provided must have the service privilege enabled.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.ImpersonateUser.LogonTypes.LOGON32_LOGON_UNLOCK
member.summary: This logon type is for GINA DLLs that log on users who will be interactively using the computer. This logon type can generate a unique audit record that shows when the workstation was unlocked.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.ImpersonateUser.LogonTypes.LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK_CLEARTEXT
member.summary: This logon type preserves the name and password in the authentication package, which allows the server to make connections to other network servers while impersonating the client. A server can accept plaintext credentials from a client, call LogonUser, verify that the user can access the system across the network, and still communicate with other servers. NOTE: Windows NT: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:gloInstallerCommandParametrs.gloInstaller.ImpersonateUser.LogonTypes.LOGON32_LOGON_NEW_CREDENTIALS
member.summary: This logon type allows the caller to clone its current token and specify new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identifier but uses different credentials for other network connections. NOTE: This logon type is supported only by the LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT50 logon provider. NOTE: Windows NT: This value is not supported.
